intro: Bauerella simplicifolia subsp. neoscotica, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and wetland habitats. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
